measured_by: composite score from 15-item riskiness ratings (5-point Likert)
justification: “To assess subjective perceived risk, we asked participants to rate the riskiness… of engaging in 15 different activities… using a 5-point Likert-type scale… We averaged ratings for the 15 items to calculate a composite score of perceived risk.”
construct: subjective perceived risk of COVID-19 transmission

measured_by: self-reported change in COVID-related media consumption (5-point Likert)
justification: “To assess independent information-seeking, we also asked participants to report how much their COVID-related media consumption habits had changed… Participants rated change in information-seeking about local COVID-19 risk statistics on a 5-point Likert scale.”

measured_by: average discrepancy between estimated and actual risk values in the Risk Estimation Task
justification: “To quantify the strength of this numerical risk intervention, we calculated information prediction errors, the discrepancy between predicted and actual risk values… the average discrepancy between estimated and actual risk values across event sizes.”
